cisc187.dna

Class FragmentList

  • java.lang.Object
    • cisc187.dna.FragmentList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Editable, Printable

    public class FragmentList
extends Object
implements Printable, Editable
    Contains an array of DNA/RNA BaseSequence character fragments. A DNA "fragment" is a sequence of either DNA characters, RNA characters, or an empty sequence. Sequencer commands that manipulate DNA sequences refer to methods manipulating sequences in this fragment list.

    Fragment capacity is fixed at construction time. Fragment entries with no BaseSequence characters within them will contain an EMPTY indicator. TODO: commands defined in the program should be an enum rather than naked strings.

    Author:
    Dave Parillo

        public String toString()
        Prints out all sequences in the fragment list. For each sequence, its position within the fragment list and the SequenceType. Nothing is output for empty sequences.

                                String command)

        Parameters:

        command - one of the commands available (print, clip, etc) this would be better implemented as an enum

        public BaseSequence sequenceAt(int pos)
        Return the sequence at position pos in the fragment list.
        Parameters:
        pos - the target position within the fragment list
        Returns:
        the BaseSequence at the requested position, if the position is valid If an invalid position is requested, then BaseSequence.EMPTY is returned.

      • insert

        public void insert(int pos,
                   SequenceType type,
                   String sequence)
        Inserts the sequence to position pos in the fragment list. The type must SequenceType DNA or RNA. The sequence is checked to verify it contains only appropriate letters for its type. If not, the insert operation is in error and no change is made to the sequence list. If there is already a sequence at pos and if sequence is syntactically correct, then the new sequence replaces the old one at that position.

        It is acceptable that sequence be null (contain no characters) in which case a null sequence will be stored at pos.

        Note that a null sequence in a sequence list slot is different from an empty slot.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        pos - the target position within the fragment list
        type - the sequence type of DNA sequence being added (DNA, RNA)
        sequence - the actual sequence to be added

      • remove

        public void remove(int pos)
        Remove the sequence at position pos in the fragment list.
        Specified by:

        pos - the target position within the fragment list

      • clip

        public BaseSequence clip(int pos,
                         int start,
                         int end)
        Replace the sequence at fragment position pos with a clipped version of the sequence. The clipped version is that part of the sequence beginning at character position start and ending with character position end.

        It is an error if start has a value less than one, or if start or end are beyond the end of the sequence. A clip command with such an error makes no alteration to the sequence.

        If there is no sequence at this slot, output a suitable message.

        If the value for end is less than the value for start then the result should be a sequence containing no characters.

        Specified by:
        clip in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        pos - the target position within the fragment list
        start - the start location within the sequence to be clipped
        end - the final location within the sequence to be clipped
        Returns:
        the part of the sequence that was clipped

      • clip

        public BaseSequence clip(int pos,
                         int start)
        Replace the sequence at fragment position pos with a clipped version of the sequence. The clipped version is that part of the sequence beginning at character position start and cnotinuing to the end of the sequence.

        It is an error if start has a value less than one, or if start is beyond the end of the sequence. A clip command with such an error makes no alteration to the sequence.

        If there is no sequence at this slot, output a suitable message.

        Specified by:
        clip in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        pos - the target position within the fragment list
        start - the start location within the sequence to be clipped
        Returns:
        the part of the sequence that was clipped

      • copy

        public void copy(int pos1,
                 int pos2)
        Copy the sequence in position pos1 to pos2. If there is no sequence at pos1, output a suitable message and do not modify the sequence at pos2.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        pos1 - the source position within the fragment list
        pos2 - the destination position within the fragment list

      • swap

        public void swap(int pos1,
                 int start1,
                 int pos2,
                 int start2)
        Swap the tails of the sequences at fragment positions pos1 and pos2. The tail for pos1 begins at character start1 and the tail for pos2 begins at character start2.

        It is an error if the value of the start position is greater than the length of the sequence or less than 1. If the length of a sequence is n, the start position may be n, meaning that the tail of the other sequence is added (i.e., a tail of null length is being swapped).

        The swap operation should be reported as an error if the two sequences are not of the same type, or if one of the slots does not contain a sequence. In either case, no change should be made to the sequences.

        Specified by:
        swap in interface Editable
        Parameters:
        pos1 - the source position within the fragment list
        start1 - the starting character position within the pos1 fragment
        pos2 - the destination position within the fragment list
        start2 - the starting character position within the pos2 fragment
